chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof, without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.```

Sovle This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
S: Set
A: S -> Prop
Mult: S -> S -> S
Add: S -> S -> S
I: S
O: S
Opp: S -> S
v: S -> nat

Goal:
is_ring -> forall a b d : S, divide d a -> A b -> divide d (Mult a b)

Premises:
is_ring = commutativity S Add /\ is_group S A Add O Opp /\ intern S A Mult /\ associativity S Mult /\ distributivity S Add Mult : Prop
divide = fun a b : S => A a /\ A b /\ (b = O \/ a <> O /\ (exists q : S, A q /\ b = Mult a q)) : S -> S -> Prop
Inductive nat : Set := O : nat | S : nat -> nat Arguments Datatypes.S _%nat_scope
div_add : is_ring -> forall a b d : S, divide d a -> divide d b -> divide d (Add a b)
is_opposite : forall S : Set, (S -> Prop) -> (S -> S -> S) -> S -> S -> S -> Prop
opp_unicity : forall (S : Set) (G : S -> Prop) (Add : S -> S -> S) (O : S) (Opp : S -> S), is_group S G Add O Opp -> forall x y : S, is_opposite S G Add O x y -> y = Opp x
opp_opp : forall (S : Set) (G : S -> Prop) (Add : S -> S -> S) (O : S) (Opp : S -> S), is_group S G Add O Opp -> forall x : S, G x -> x = Opp (Opp x)
distributivity : forall S : Set, (S -> S -> S) -> (S -> S -> S) -> Prop
neutral : forall S : Set, (S -> Prop) -> (S -> S -> S) -> S -> Prop
regular_l : forall (S : Set) (G : S -> Prop) (Add : S -> S -> S) (O : S) (Opp : S -> S), is_group S G Add O Opp -> forall y z : S, G y -> G z -> forall x : S, G x -> Add x y = Add x z -> y = z
opposite : forall S : Set, (S -> Prop) -> (S -> S -> S) -> S -> (S -> S) -> Prop
is_group : forall S : Set, (S -> Prop) -> (S -> S -> S) -> S -> (S -> S) -> Prop
associativity : forall S : Set, (S -> S -> S) -> Prop
commutativity : forall S : Set, (S -> S -> S) -> Prop
intern : forall S : Set, (S -> Prop) -> (S -> S -> S) -> Prop
div_O_O = fun H : is_ring => and_ind (fun (_ : commutativity S Add) (H1 : is_group S A Add O Opp /\ intern S A Mult /\ associativity S Mult /\ distributivity S Add Mult) => and_ind (fun (H2 : is_group S A Add O Opp) (_ : intern S A Mult /\ associativity S Mult /\ distributivity S Add Mult) => and_ind (fun (_ : intern S A Add) (H5 : associativity S Add /\ neutral S A Add O /\ opposite S A Add O Opp) => and_ind (fun (_ : associativity S Add) (H7 : neutral S A Add O /\ opposite S A Add O Opp) => and_ind (fun (H8 : neutral S A Add O) (_ : opposite S A Add O Opp) => and_ind (fun (H10 : A O) (_ : forall x : S, A x -> Add x O = x /\ Add O x = x) => conj H10 (conj H10 (or_introl eq_refl))) H8) H7) H5) H2) H1) H : is_ring...
integrity = forall a b : S, Mult a b = O -> {a = O} + {b = O} : Set
mult_opp_l : is_ring -> forall x y : S, A x -> A y -> Mult (Opp x) y = Opp (Mult x y)
mult_opp_r : is_ring -> forall x y : S, A x -> A y -> Mult x (Opp y) = Opp (Mult x y)
PeanoNat.Nat.gcd_div_factor : forall a b c : nat, c <> 0 -> PeanoNat.Nat.divide c a -> PeanoNat.Nat.divide c b -> PeanoNat.Nat.gcd (PeanoNat.Nat.div a c) (PeanoNat.Nat.div b c) = PeanoNat.Nat.div (PeanoNat.Nat.gcd a b) c
PeanoNat.Nat.divide_div_mul_exact : forall a b c : nat, b <> 0 -> PeanoNat.Nat.divide b a -> PeanoNat.Nat.div (c * a) b = c * PeanoNat.Nat.div a b
PeanoNat.Nat.gcd_greatest : forall a b c : nat, PeanoNat.Nat.divide c a -> PeanoNat.Nat.divide c b -> PeanoNat.Nat.divide c (PeanoNat.Nat.gcd a b)
is_unitary_commutative_ring = is_ring /\ commutativity S Mult /\ neutral S A Mult I : Prop
BinPos.Pos.gcdn_greatest : forall (n : nat) (a b : BinNums.positive), BinPos.Pos.size_nat a + BinPos.Pos.size_nat b <= n -> forall p : BinNums.positive, BinPos.Pos.divide p a -> BinPos.Pos.divide p b -> BinPos.Pos.divide p (BinPos.Pos.gcdn n a b)
PeanoNat.Nat.div_small : forall a b : nat, a < b -> PeanoNat.Nat.div a b = 0
PeanoNat.Nat.pow_nonzero : forall a b : nat, a <> 0 -> PeanoNat.Nat.pow a b <> 0
PeanoNat.Nat.mod_divide : forall a b : nat, b <> 0 -> PeanoNat.Nat.modulo a b = 0 < -> PeanoNat.Nat.divide b a
PeanoNat.Nat.gcd_mod : forall a b : nat, b <> 0 -> PeanoNat.Nat.gcd (PeanoNat.Nat.modulo a b) b = PeanoNat.Nat.gcd b a
PeanoNat.Nat.div_exact : forall a b : nat, b <> 0 -> a = b * PeanoNat.Nat.div a b < -> PeanoNat.Nat.modulo a b = 0
PeanoNat.Nat.div_mul : forall a b : nat, b <> 0 -> PeanoNat.Nat.div (a * b) b = a
PeanoNat.Nat.bits_inj : forall a b : nat, PeanoNat.Nat.eqf (PeanoNat.Nat.testbit a) (PeanoNat.Nat.testbit b) -> a = b
mult_opp_opp : is_ring -> forall x y : S, A x -> A y -> Mult (Opp x) (Opp y) = Mult x y
PeanoNat.Nat.lcm_equiv1 : forall a b : nat, PeanoNat.Nat.gcd a b <> 0 -> a * PeanoNat.Nat.div b (PeanoNat.Nat.gcd a b) = PeanoNat.Nat.div (a * b) (PeanoNat.Nat.gcd a b)
mult_O : is_ring -> forall x : S, A x -> Mult x O = O /\ Mult O x = O
Record div_theory (R : Type) (req : R -> R -> Prop) (C : Type) (cadd cmul : C -> C -> C) (phi : C -> R) (cdiv : C -> C -> C * C) : Prop := mkdiv_th { div_eucl_th : forall a b : C, let (q, r) := cdiv a b in req (phi a) (phi (cadd (cmul b q) r)) } Arguments Ring_theory.div_theory [R]%type_scope _%function_scope [C]%type_scope (_ _ _ _)%function_scope Arguments Ring_theory.mkdiv_th [R]%type_scope _%function_scope [C]%type_scope (_ _ _ _ _)%function_scope
List.nth : forall A : Type, nat -> list A -> A -> A
List.map : forall A B : Type, (A -> B) -> list A -> list B
PeanoNat.Nat.central_induction : forall A : nat -> Prop, Morphisms.Proper (Morphisms.respectful eq iff) A -> forall z : nat, A z -> (forall n : nat, A n <-> A (Datatypes.S n)) -> forall n : nat, A n
List.firstn : forall A : Type, nat -> list A -> list A
PeanoNat.Nat.lnot = fun a n : nat => PeanoNat.Nat.lxor a (PeanoNat.Nat.ones n) : nat -> nat -> nat Arguments PeanoNat.Nat.lnot (_ _)%nat_scope
PeanoNat.Nat.lor_lnot_diag_low : forall a n : nat, PeanoNat.Nat.log2 a < n -> PeanoNat.Nat.lor a (PeanoNat.Nat.lnot a n) = PeanoNat.Nat.ones n
PeanoNat.Nat.lor_ones_low : forall a n : nat, PeanoNat.Nat.log2 a < n -> PeanoNat.Nat.lor a (PeanoNat.Nat.ones n) = PeanoNat.Nat.ones n
Relation_Definitions.relation = fun A : Type => A -> A -> Prop : Type -> Type Arguments Relation_Definitions.relation _%type_scope

``` 
intros H a b d Hd Ha.
unfold divide in Hd. unfold divide. 
destruct Hd as [Ha_d [Hb_eq | [Ha_nO [q [Hq [Hb_eq]]]]]].
- auto.
- split.
  + exact Ha_d.
  + right. exists q. split.
    * exact Hq.
    * rewrite Hb_eq. auto.
```

original: intros H a b d Hd Ha. unfold divide in Hd. unfold divide. destruct Hd as [Ha_d [Hb_eq | [Ha_nO [q [Hq [Hb_eq]]]]]]. - auto. - split. + apply Ha_d. + right. exists q. split. * apply Hq. * rewrite Hb_eq. auto.
